title: 109_s3542
content: The "Project SeaHawk Implementation Act of 2006" establishes additional interagency operational centers for port security. The Secretary of Homeland Security will establish interagency operational centers for maritime and port security in each Coast Guard sector to enhance coordination, cooperation, and intelligence sharing for protecting against terrorism. The centers will be co-located with the command centers in each sector. The Secretary will establish interagency operational centers for maritime and port security in each Coast Guard sector, utilizing electronic communications for connectivity. Each center will be modeled after the Charleston Harbor Operations Center and adapted to meet the security needs of individual port areas. Participation by relevant entities is required. The interagency operational centers for maritime and port security will involve participation from various entities including the United States Coast Guard, the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Defense, the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and state and local law enforcement agencies. The responsibilities of each center established for maritime and port security include assisting in implementing transportation security plans and incident response plans as required by law. Participants in these centers may include state and local law enforcement agencies, port authority representatives, maritime exchanges, and private sector stakeholders. The responsibilities of maritime and port security centers include implementing transportation security plans, vessel tracking, information sharing activities, cargo inspection programs, and other related duties. The responsibilities of maritime and port security centers include implementing transportation security plans, vessel tracking, information sharing activities, and cargo inspection programs. Additionally, they are required to carry out other responsibilities as determined by the Secretary of Homeland Security. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a report to various Senate and House committees within 180 days of the Act's enactment, detailing the establishment of each center under section 2(a), including location, participating entities, costs, and necessary resources. The Commandant of the Coast Guard will use information from a previous report to fulfill the requirements of this Act. Appropriations are authorized for each Coast Guard sector from 2007 to 2012 to implement the Act.
